wikipedia_page.main: Emma Carrick-Anderson (born 17 June 1975) is a Scottish former alpine skier who competed for Great Britain at the Winter Olympic Games in 1992, 1994, 1998 and 2002.

response: Originally from Dunblane, Carrick-Anderson learned to ski in the Cairngorms and became the Scottish Junior Champion in slalom skiing. He subsequently spent six years on the British Ski Team, and claimed medals in the sport in several editions of the Winter Deaflympics.Crawford Carrick-Anderson, International Committee of Sports for the Deaf. Retrieved 28 November 2021 By the time he quit skiing at the age of 23, he was Britain's highest ranked Slalom Skier. His younger sister EmmaA dedication to excellence; close-up; Emma Carrick-Anderson, Andrew Baker, The Independent, 11 February 1996  represented Great Britain as an alpine skier at four Winter Olympic Games.
